website_summaries.verdict: A popular model in terms of quality, stability, and output. The best choice if you want a solid 3D printer at a mid-range price.
cons: Can be noisy, and setup can be slightly difficult

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: We received this printer on 6/9/2017. It's broken the next day. One of the white wires caught on fire. I called FlashForge repeatedly. After several attempts, they refused to take responsibility. They said, since I purchased this through Amazon, they'll not responsible for any damage or support. What a waste of time and money. I strongly discourage anyone from purchasing this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: good luck with techinical support
customer_reviews.text: Bought my creator pro a few weeks ago, tryed to load software included and never completes, loading stops and locks up computer, talked to amazon support and he kept calling flashforge for help put on hold for hour (also have hard time understanding), finally I just asked for flashforge's phone number and called direct was told to uninstall software multiple times and reload older versions, no help , having to resolve issue myself, if anyone is thinking of a creator pro, and want to use included software good luck, I have a 900 buck paper weight. Will try to return for another brand!
customer_reviews.author: martin p.

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Problems for Me
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 of these printers from Amazon. The first lost electrical contact and would not do anything. Amazon replaced it with one that would not extrude filament. Amazon replace this one and this one would lock up and not move. So I sent it back. When the printers would print they wee great. Just too many internal problems for me to own one.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Marsh Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I brought the printer so my son and I could experiment with building . We have spent more time taking it apart to get it to work then it has actually worked. The print heads get clogged religiously , the board always needs to be re-balanced and we have even had one nozzle become useless because the material hardened in the tub . Look for another printer ...
customer_reviews.author: LAwrence Verdi

customer_reviews.title: poor support
customer_reviews.text: received item broken and missing parts, took a week of emails with flashforge to get to the point of them doing nothing returned it and bought the QIDI its great
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It's an excellent FFF printer
customer_reviews.text: I've clocked over 800 hours on it, and have owned this one for over four years. The slicer software it came with (back in 2014) was aggravating, and caused this to be a paperweight for a couple of years. Eventually I decided to get my kids interested in tech, and this seemed like a good way to go. I picked up Simplify 3d and never looked back. The prints I uploaded used Simplify 3d. It's a solid printer, built for use. I've replaced a few things since 2014, and upgraded the filament holders (though they may have changed the design since then) It's a reliable piece of tech that my family enjoys using.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great pro-sumer printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mid range printer for those looking to get into 3d printing. The performance is much better than printers in the $200-500 range. Having dual nozzles is great but can be pretty difficult to get setup. I highly suggest using Simplify3D as it made the dual colors a lot easier than standard Cura. Nozzles are very cheap to replace compared to the name brand Makerbot printer that is comparable. I had to replace a few motors as well over the years. This printer has been running strong for over 2 years now and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Great 3d Printer & After-Sale Support!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up on Black Friday and have been really impressed. The included slicer software is really easy to use with minimal learning curve (compared to others). The print quality is great whether I'm printing D&D minis, or larger functional objects. Ghosting is an issue at faster print speeds due to the weight of the carriage, but you just have to account for that in your settings. I've been blown away with their after-sale support. Really prompt responses to any question I've had, and the one issue I've run into (caused by improper installation of hotend) their support was very friendly & helpful. Definitely a quality printer for both beginners & experienced makers.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but I find it annoying that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but I find it annoying that I have to transfer the 3D files to the printer using the SD card when there is a USB connector on the device. The manual for the slicer says there is an option to transfer the files to the unit, but there is no option as such in the real software I purchased SIMPLY3D for the slicer, and it allows total control of the printer via USB The only complaint I have left, is that all the companies selling filament have a different type of spool; most will not work with the spool holders on the back of this unit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just not for me...
customer_reviews.text: I read so many great reviews of this printer that I thought buying it was a no-brainer. To be honest, I don't think myself and the Creator Pro were compatible. I found myself constantly having to adjust, re-adjust, level, re-level and basically reset the unit before and after each print. Granted, I'm not a 3D printing expert, but I viewed many tutorials that just didn't result in what I'd hoped. Print quality was okay. Layers were visible sometimes. Nozzle seemed durable, and the dual heads are nice. I just think this might be a printer for someone with a little more experience, patience, or both. Ultimately, I ended up selling this printer and bought a Zortrax - which I'm loving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3d printing is hard, but if you want a puzzle hobby its perfect
customer_reviews.text: this is a great quality printer that works great with open source content. You will be able to do pretty much anything you want with this printer especially for the price. It will be able to do metal and wood if you swap out the extruder. pretty easy to figure out but you have to accept a certain amount of puzzle. The flashforge CAD software is weird, but you just import from another CAD if you want. I have not used the tech support just forums. I would guess by the bad english on the manual that it may not be worth using. Still doesn't matter I would rather figure it out by myself
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer and easy to use. I have 3 Taz 5 printers for big jobs, but this one is great for small jobs and the dual extruder is the icing on the cake. It can print very accurately, a little more precisely than the Taz printers. The bed is easy to level. And there are lots of spare parts included. LED lighting is cool. Only thing I don't like is the filament spool holders - but I can print better ones. I would recommend this printer for beginners and advanced users alike.
customer_reviews.author: MotoGuy

customer_reviews.title: I was getting good prints right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: My first 3D printer and it seems to work very well. I was getting good prints right out of the box. I've learned so much in the last couple of weeks. I'm using blue painters tape and a thin coat of Elmers Purple glue stick on every print now. I put the tape directly on the original blue sticker and get great adhesion. It came with 2 rolls of ABS but I'm using Esun PLA+ for almost every print. Got a roll of PETG coming so looking forward to that.
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: The Creator Pro is a fantastic value - printing at a level expected at twice its retail cost.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Creator Pro. Coming from a Dremel 3D40, I am learning many new concepts and configurations that are hidden from the Dremel user. Unboxing was straightforward and I finished my first ABS print a few hours later. I like how everything runs under Python. Slicing can require patience for complex builds but there are workarounds to speed up the process. Printing can proceed faster than on the Dremel and I love the dual extruders! The build surface supplied is near-impossible to remove -- work around this by shutting off the printer and carefully saturating the surface with Goof-Off. It dissolves the adhesive and all that gunk can be scraped off with a blade.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great first experience with 3d printing
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3d printing experience and have loved the Creator Pro. I've noticed some reviews on here and understand some people's frustrations about tinkering with the machine but I assume this is required for a 3d printer. It's not overly complex but there is definitely a bit of a learning curve for beginners but between the documentation on the device and online forums (like the 3d Printing Stack Exchange forum) I'm off and printing every night pretty easily now!
customer_reviews.author: Fan

customer_reviews.title: Help
customer_reviews.text: i have had this printer since January 2018 . i am having troubles and no support. link doesnt work . if there is someone can help that would be great
customer_reviews.author: Marina L. Risher

customer_reviews.title: Works good until it starts to fall apart
customer_reviews.text: It works good until it starts to fall apart for no reason just after a year when the warranty ends... my printer makes this loud cracking noises that I believe is coming from the x axis pulley. I out of warranty period and parts are not readily available for this printer... Sooo gonna have to figure out if I can hack fix it to keep running or else it's gonna go in the dump... what a waste of money.... :(
customer_reviews.author: Mike N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit 4 months now, Leveled the bead and bought Simplify 3d. No issues I mostly print using the same pla for support and the model. But I have used it in dual extrusion mode and all it does is work very well. I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W. Overbeck

customer_reviews.title: First 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great! I had a slight mishap during the initial setup/unboxing, but I was able to correct the issue. Still, FlashForge was willing to replace the part and even though I didn't need it, that willingness proved to me that I made the right choice in selecting this as my first 3D printer. Going along with this printer, I strongly recommend purchasing the Simplify3D software. It is well worth it and makes it easy to get started with 3D printing. Overall, I am extremely happy with this printer being my first!
customer_reviews.author: Boost Hub Business Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for student budget but very happy so far.
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Very happy. Expensive for a student budget but a world of difference from my pervious experience buying cheaper product from a taiwanese company that turned out to be anightware.
customer_reviews.author: hosrow jaffarbhoy

customer_reviews.title: Originally I gave this printer a good review as It's a good printer for the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally I gave this printer a good review as It's a good printer for the price but, after about 4 month o use everything is braking on this printer, I had to replace the whole print head assembly with a more robust aftermarket parts. I do not recommend this printer unless you want to keep fixing it.
customer_reviews.author: Igor C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer but the software makes it unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Like my title said, it's a well built printer, physically speaking. However, it ONLY works with software written and provided by the manufacturer. It's horrendous compared to open-source stuff like Repetier-host. The software is more difficult to use, crashes a lot and - most importantly - produces poor quality prints. I've ran into many bugs in the software where it refuses to add infill, walls, ceilings, etc. It's really too bad. I do like the printer a lot but simply can't use it since the manufacturer decided to cripple it with software.
customer_reviews.author: David Pedu

customer_reviews.title: I might loose my job, my girlfriend, and my mind over this machine but I think I'm in love.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this machine a week an a half ago. Ever since then I have been unable to get more then 5 hours sleep in each night. I have become a hermit leaving the house only when absolutely necessary, trying to keep prints running 24/7. I now suffer from delusions of grandeur and hear the sound of the printer everywhere I go for some reason (and in my dreams oddly enough). This is the most amazing and maddening piece of technology I have ever owned and I just cant put it down.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite machine this size.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. I have several printers and run them non stop. This is my new favorite in the price range. The metal frame is very sturdy for the price. Every screw is super tight- and seemingly thread locked in- so no rattling. I opened the box- assembled a few things and both heads printed perfectly the first try. The hood is silly laser cut acrylic with screws, but this is just to rush to market.. the new model has a better set up. I liek to modify my machines and although it isn't open source it is easily modified, and has a nice open frame to work in.
customer_reviews.author: Trex

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding printer
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding 3d printer. They picked up where Maker box left behind the Replicator 2x and make it better and cheaper. Every print is great. A fan was broken when it arrived but customer service was great and sent me a new one. I use Simply3D for slicing which has some great settings. Always print with a raft. I also use astroprint on a raspberry pi connected to a webcam so I can watch my prints from anywhere. Only failed print was because my filament absorbed to much moisture and became brittle or because I push it up against the wall and the spool couldn't spin freely. Owned for 1 year and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Excellent print quality
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box with high quality prints Only problem is that when I set it up in didn't measure the difference in nozzle height because I was excited just you get it running and assumed that came preset. One nozzle was a good .03 to .04 off which led to dragging. They need to be dead nuts if you plan on printing large prints. Also they changed the design to stupid. Can't just remove a fan to adjust anymore the set screw is in the back. Stupid logic there, so you got to remove the whole head. Eventually I'll drill and tap the front. Great printer so far, just stupid quirks
customer_reviews.author: PdOffGuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great part output.
customer_reviews.text: We love this printer. We are using this at a college to support science and have found so many uses. As people see parts that come out they think of something else it would be good for. I was happy to see how accurate the parts are printed. We like this printer so much we purchased a 2nd one for the students to use. As far as a learning curve to run it. It could not be easier from start to finish. I also like that you can print 2 colors with in the part since it has 2 heads. If your looking to buy a 3D printer, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rich DW

customer_reviews.title: When the bottom surface is well balanced, everything is working like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, some Filament types are not well fitted on the holders at the back so need to fix them in other way such as mounting the printer close to the wall. Once assembled and balanced, using Simplify3D software it was very easy to start and everything is working properly in less than 1 hour from opening the box. No need special experience, just make sure to balance the bottom surface to be very tight to the extruder. Even more tight than the what you get with the provided paper.
customer_reviews.author: gilo

customer_reviews.title: Works great! LEVEL
customer_reviews.text: Works great! LEVEL, LEVEL, LEVEL. None note: Level the plate with the top cover removed as the filament tubes hitting the cover can exert pressure on the extruders and cause what seems like a "high spot" in the middle of your bed. Now I leave the rear tabs unlocked on the top cover but keep it in place during printing. Excellent prints so far. Day one and loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Et1ssusn

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am very satisfied with the 2 I bought
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very satisfied with the 2 I bought. My main 3 gripes are 1)Please move over to a gcode platform for printing 2) the spool holders that come with this unit are such garbave. They over complicated a simple design that is sized to there spools. Please switch over to a standard one size fits all spool holder so my first print doesn't have to be them with a head ache. 3) it makes a horrible noise before each print. This should be fixed with some grease but its kind of off putting HONESTLY IF THE SPOOL HOLDERS WERE BETTER I WOULD HAVE BOUGHT 2 MORE
customer_reviews.author: Derek Schuetz

customer_reviews.title: Great 3d printer for the amatuer to the professional.
customer_reviews.text: As an industrial designer I am constantly coming up with new ideas and trying to test them was always a problem. The Flashforge Creator X fits perfectly on my dresser, and maintaining the printer is easy. I make my CAD files and send them to replicator, then when it's done I hit print and wait for my part. However, I will note that you should not use the kapton tape. I use scotch blue painters tape and it works better. Sometimes I will use purple elmers glue for extra support. Also, Tang has been super helpful. Whenever I have an issue he responds promptly and his advice is great. By far the best costumer service I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Niedballer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: We spend the second day trying to get it work. This machine does not work at all! Not even the pre-loaded test design would print. Produces only misprints. The company sits in China and it seems to be hard to get any support. This is the first item that I will have to send back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Becker

customer_reviews.title: Must have device for PLA and ABS printing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a owner of the MakerBot Replicator Dual (2012)... it died. The Flashforge Creator Pro ratings got my attention after purchasing and returning two competing units. The Flashforge Creator Pro is self-enclosed so no more heat/cooling issues due to changing room temperatures. The Creator Pro's LCD rev 7.8 has all the functions to print directly from the supplied 16g SD card. No issues with PLA and ABS not sticking to the Flashforge hot plate. I like the three-point leveling function, plus Cold Pausing - what great features. The quality and Flashforge support is unmatched with a 1-year warranty. This 3D device has all the improvements, quality and tight accuracy I need for my dual extruder 3D printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: THX1138

customer_reviews.title: but now I'm pretty satisfied. This thing is a very sturdy machine
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out how this printer works and how to achieve acceptable quality if prints, but now I'm pretty satisfied. This thing is a very sturdy machine. The only downside I see is whatever printing settings I use parts always have "big foot" printing defect. But this is something I can deal with using sandpaper. Learning curve is not simple, but hey, it's meant for geeks, so some geeky complexity is just fine =)
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Karpushin

customer_reviews.title: have confidence in this choice
customer_reviews.text: as a rookie additive manufacturer I had paralysis by analysis on all of the choices. Fortunately I had a guru that confirmed the FlashForge Creator Pro as a solid choice with many features only offered at higher price points. I still have a lot to learn about fine tuning my prints, and I do recommend grabbing slic3r to replace the included slicing software, but I'm very happy with the 8 prints I've done in abs already. It's also nice to know that Mr. Tang at FlashForge is ready to help based on the very nice email I received with the manual just after I placed my order.
customer_reviews.author: HerbieFish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer for the money, coupled with great customer service
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased this for me for Christmas. I was very pleased that this was almost ready to go out of the box. I have built another 3D printer in the past and getting things tuned just right was a worry of mine. This one was up and printing good quality prints right out of the box within about an hour. I had one small issue with the Z-axis making some noise. I emailed Tang and as other reviews have stated he emailed me back almost right away. I followed his instructions and everything was taken care of. Very pleased with the printer and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: TheMarshalls

customer_reviews.title: the printer works like a champ so far
customer_reviews.text: It took less time to get assembled and printing than my outdoor grill took to assemble. The printer has been humming away all weekend since it arrived. I needed to prototype some parts, and had never used a 3d printer before. I do have some basic to intermediate skills at modeling, which does help to get going. However, the printer works like a champ so far. (I'll update if this changes) Edit: 3 weeks of owning it, 190 hours of printing, almost 1km of filament! Keeps on printing! (Only minor cut of pad when taking a print off)
customer_reviews.author: RE

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for just over a year now, all in all the prints have been good quality although like any 3d printer at this point it does require you to learn how to calibrate the machine which takes some trial and error. Last month the nozzles got completely clogged up which resulted in me having to replace the entire heating element which was a bit challenging, but the good thing is that FlashForge has an online store to get these replacement parts and has a lot of good youtube videos that instructs you how to perform these various maintenance activities when they inevitably occur.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Nelson

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very, very pleased with this product! I did a lot of research on 3D printers before purchasing. I dug through websites, reviews, forums and then compared and contrasted every product out there based on affordability, features, support, durability, customer reviews, and user community. The FlashForge Creator Pro came out far ahead of every other product. It is essentially a "makerbot" replica but the support through Amazon and Tang as well as a better price were the deciding factors for me. This is my first 3D printer and I don't see the need to ever go with any other product.
customer_reviews.author: Momaha

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have a good build quality. Prepare to tinker! It plugs up a lot, and less than half of the prints turn out due to plugged extruder nozzles. Not sure what to do! I can only print small things because the larger prints all get scrapped due to print failures.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: ready to print
customer_reviews.text: This is such a improvement over my first printer. I bought a kit Prusa clone some time ago. Cheep, but because of the low quality of the aluminum bed I had many print failures and lots of frustration. I stopped using it. The Flashforge Creator Pro. is well thought out and works. Now I am making printed objects in a three step process: draw, slice, print. This consistency means I can begin experimenting with other materials such as petg, and carbon fiber. Dislikes: smaller print bed, the sd card slot is inside the inclosure, Likes: The bed leveling is Easy, holds it's adjustments, dual extruder.
customer_reviews.author: Roy N. Sabolevsky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, tried and true machine
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 now, and they are fabulous. Whats great is even if or when trouble does come up (clogs, upgrades, firmware stuff) there is an enormous community of owners out there to help you solve it. However- this baby, worked right out of the box for me- but that is is because I didn't use the filament it comes with- I'd avoid the in box stuff. I had a mess of trouble with it. Thats the only down fall, and its easily avoided. I love both of my units!
customer_reviews.author: PaintSCastillo

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Read all the labels!
customer_reviews.text: I watched a video on YouTube on how to set it up, it was easy to follow, just I dropped a couple of small pieces in the tiny openings inside the machine. So that part was a mission. After setup, the filament got stuck on the first print. Very stressful but Tang in customer support helped out a lot. The cause was that YOU NEED TO LEAVE THE DOOR OPEN AND TAKE OFF THE TOP FOR PLA. Didn’t know this and didn’t read that it instructed me to on the side. Read everything you can and avoid a headache. But A1 customer support, print quality is great, and it’s very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Salas

customer_reviews.title: ... and I have found that this has been my best buying experience to date
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 other manufacturers 3D printers and I have found that this has been my best buying experience to date. Tang, who is the representative for FlashForge, is very knowledgeable about the printers operation and responds to emails quickly. The printer is well built and I prefer it to the MakerBot generation 5 I purchased hands down. I had a few small problems but this was my not being familiar with the sailfish slicing engine and trying to use my prior experience with other slicer engines. I did have to perform a calibration alignment but Tang made this very easy with the documentation that he provided.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great machine great suport
customer_reviews.text: I am new on 3D printers. I need one to make some parts for a new project.After I got the printer, i had some problems, because the manual is not up to date. So I was looking for things they do not exixst any more. Then I comunicate with a suport guy. You find his email on the manual. From this moment I was out of trouble. He ansered all my questions and was very very helpfull. Now I printed a sample. Wao, so easy. However you need some time to find out by your self some tricks.All over a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: JOWA

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer with the best customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I've recently purchased the FlashForge Creator Pro and I started printing and the machine works perfectly. I must say setting up the printer and becoming familiar with its functions and parts was fairly easy but on those little areas where I needed assistance or just had general questions, Tang responded to each question usually within 8-10 hours. This seller is exceptional and I can't recommend him highly enough to express how helpful and responsive he was to my every question. He even responded politely and timely when I was just thanking him for his help. Flash Forge is a great 3D printer and Tang provides top rated customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 3D printing machine about 2 years ago. Still going strong! The only bit as a user with absolute precision is to ensure alignment to the plate every now and then due to slight movement. Great product! Btw the customer service is superb!
customer_reviews.author: Nwonknu

customer_reviews.title: So happy.  So good. Incredible!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how amazing this thing is. I bought this with the expectation of having some aggravation and tinkering to do before it would really live up to its full potential. Totally not the case. From the first switch on this thing was turning out amazingly detailed, beautiful parts. I'm still blown away by it every time I use it. I can't believe how easy going this was. You honestly can't go wrong with this thing. One tip I've discovered. Turn the cooling fan off if you're printing ABS.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Since the purchase I have been greatly pleased with the unit - it operates exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I researched all the 3D printers out there and this one came out on top. Since the purchase I have been greatly pleased with the unit - it operates exactly as advertised. I have printed approx. 50 models with great results. Add to that, the best support I have ever had with a purchase. I cannot say enough about how well this printer is supported - any question or problem I encountered was addressed immediately and accurately. If and when I purchase another 3D printer it will be this one. Just can't go wrong with a great product and even better support. Bottom line - this is the best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: FlashForge 3d Printer Creator Pro Works Flawlessly Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a 3d printer just did not know which one to choose. Well I did the reviews, and guess what? They are right for the money you just cannot beat this printer. First and foremost this printer has unsurpassed customer service which I have found to be second to none. There is only one person whom you relate to with all your issues, and that is the sweet part about owning this well made device. I suspect the person who is responsible for the service is somehow involved with the design. At any rate you will go wrong owning this printer, especially if it is your first.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Sanniota

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good for the money. It will break. You will need to fix it. It is a bare bones machine with no frills. If you want something where you open the box and print forever, get a different machine. If you want something you can (and have to) take apart and rebuild, get this. It's okay for the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.. Skip the blue stickers, go for the PEI
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. I am using it with the Simplify 3d software and everything works easily. Save yourself some time and nix the blue stickers on the print bed. The first layer either sticks so much that you cant get the part off without ripping the sticker or the first layer doesnt stick. I recently bought the PEI sheet and cut it to size and keep it on using 4 paper clamps and works flawlessly. I just wish i would have done it months ago instead of messing with those blue stickers constantly ripping and messing up my prints. It sticks amazingly well for the first layer and pops right off when it cools down. Have only tried ABS on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome After Some Prep Work
customer_reviews.text: There are some items that you need to print to make this function as well as you'd like, but it is great once all set-up items are created and attached. It works right out of the box, it's just got some dribbling and the second spool unravels without some additional pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B

customer_reviews.title: So happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this printer. There are very good thorough reviews here that cover just about everything. It wasn't difficult to put together. I was able to get it to print right away. The only thing that has been tricky for me is replacing the blue build platform cover material. It is *very* sticky underneath. The easiest way I've found to get it off is to carefully remove it while it's hot and use a scrapper with a new razor to scrape of the glue. It only takes a few minutes that way. It's a really nice surface to print ABS onto.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenWandDove

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: First off, Tang has great customer service. He provided contact and a manual before the product arrived. I had one slight issue with the front opening plate not aligning. Tang responded the same day and shipped a new part to me. This didn't prevent the machine from working. So i was able to start right away. I decided to use Simplify3D for the slicing software after reading good reviews. From the mechanical aspects, the FlashForge Creator Pro worked great out of the box. The printed manual explained how to assemble everything clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Company and Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3d printer and I've had it for about a month. Since I'm not knowledgeable about other printers please take my review with a grain of salt. But I do have to say this printer exceeded my expectations, and since it was my first printer there was defintely a learning curve. Aside from the technical side of the machine I was confident on my purchase since this company has had great reviews, and it;s no wonder since their printer works pretty much flawlessly once calibrated with the right settings(which is what took me the longest to fine tune). I hope this was somewhat helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, Excellent Support!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with both this printer and with the great support provided by FlashForge. Set up was fairly trivial (the hardest part was peeling the protective paper off of the fiberglass cover and window). I was also contacted by support before the printer even arrived with instructions as well as advice on what to do if I encountered any difficulties. I had my first print going within about 45 minutes of opening the box. I am thrilled with the quality of the prints and with the software that came with the printer. Overall, I could not be more pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great service.  Great printer.
customer_reviews.text: Great printing. Great value. Not plug and play, but nothing is. Within 30 minutes I was printing. After 1 month, I am in awe. I have no issues. I've been printing constantly. My high quality white ABS look almost like ceramic. 2 heads are super convenient. customer service is amazing. If you are looking for an entry level printer This is it! I started with an M3D micro. At $399 I spent most of the time trying to correct backlash, temperature or bed height. Even my best print from the micro looks like garbage compared to anything from this machine. I've contacted customer service twice, both times I was given the info I needed within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was packaged very well. The instructions were very clear. I had it working within 3 hours of very careful setup and following of instructions. I recommend printing out a new filament tube holder for the back ( For ABS, I found that 105 degrees C seems to work better than the recommended 90 degrees C. Later, I think I will buy Kapton tape and put one layer under the left extruder because it sits slightly lower than the right extruder.
customer_reviews.author: this_guy

customer_reviews.title: ... manufacturing I have to say that this was the best purchase that could have been made
customer_reviews.text: After buying this product for manufacturing I have to say that this was the best purchase that could have been made. For the price this has performed for over 3 weeks straight and has hardly had any breaks. I've been using ABS and have learned a lot from using this machine. When printing ABS the enclosure as well as the heat temp of the bed and nozzle have been good. Slight warping does occur, but from reading, large prints can't be helped. Also I would suggest that you buy the glass plate if you do ABS. Some Aqua Net super hold does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It broke after 10 minutes. No reply from support after opening a ticket for several days.
customer_reviews.text: Worked 10 minutes then the right extruder started making a loud clicking noise with no extrusion. It was wrapped around the actuator drive inside the assembly. Got it fixed and the left extruder clogged 5 minutes later and cannot be unclogged. Opened a ticket with support which 5 days later....still no reply. I am returning this item as soon as I can take it back apart and pack it back up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this dude for over a year and it's still printing strong. Pull off the blue plastic build plate and get a glass plate and a glue stick and don't look back. The only problems I've had thus far have been learning curve for print settings and maintenance. In a year i've had to replace one thermocouple that went haywire. Any other problems I've had you would have on any FDM style printer.
customer_reviews.author: Just A Geek

customer_reviews.title: Not for non-PC/printer knowledgeable buyers
customer_reviews.text: I love the printer. The available of printable items is awesome, and I have tried many. I bought Simplify3D, and it is very easy to use. Connecting to my PC is tricky, but tech suggested never printing directly from PC, so I've always used SD card supplied with the printer. I'm totally inexperienced with 3D printing but with very limited instructions included with the printer was able to get started quickly, and am happy with my results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The printer came with a piece of filiment stuck in one of the extruders and the table isn't very flat. I bought one if these a few years ago when they first came out and the build quality has gone waaaaay down hill since then . I would try and encourage you to buy a cheaper clone.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for about 3 months now and use it extensively for projects related to my PhD research. It's the second FF printer that I've bought. Awesome quality and Mr. Tang is a super helpful guy if there are ever any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Miles V. Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. The first print (test file in the supplied SD card) was success. Printing boxes for small electronics device and it is cheaper and easier than buying generic cases.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive, loud for almost no reason, quality of the print not super great.
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive, loud for almost no reason, quality of the print not super great... Takes a very long time to print as well. like 3D printer usually take a while, but this one take a very long time... not to mention that it makes a horrible (almost like the old sound dial up made connecting to the internet) sound the whole time it is printing... would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CALICO

customer_reviews.title: Great printer great price
customer_reviews.text: The good : Easy instructions for setup , so far the first 3 prints are perfect, did the dual extruder test, the regular test, and the moving elephant from thingsverse. The kinda bad but probably user issue : I'm having some oozing even in the default test prints Also not so bad but when the printer does very fine movements it jerks a bit and rattles the door, easy fix with some tape. I'll update in a month or two
customer_reviews.author: Busdriver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support from Mr. Tang, and a great printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been about as close to a open-it-and-print experience that the maturity of the technology allows for. It prints very good with very little adjustment. Mr Tang has been wonderful to work with. His communication has been rapid and his willingness to help is stellar. I would recommend this printer and Mr Tang's service to anyone. I've printed about 1kg worth of ABS thus far and have been very pleased at the quality.
customer_reviews.author: TylerC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say about this one. - Instructions: 5/5 - Software installation: 5/5 - Actual 3D printing: 5/5 This was my first 3D printer. I had it assembled in about 15 mins and a couple of minutes later I was printing my first model. I've gone through almost 2 spools of filament since then with absolutely 0 issues. 5/5 stars and a no-brainer buy.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Not open source at all. Flashforge is lying
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly misleading to say this product is open source. The firmware source code is not available anywhere, and when I asked customer support for it, they told me they can’t help. I refuse to support a company that outright lies to consumers
customer_reviews.author: A hairy guy

customer_reviews.title: This printer is just what I was looking for - great prints, fast
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable and well built printer. I initially had bought an inexpensive printer (~$300), but it printed poorly and had issues. This printer is just what I was looking for - great prints, fast, and consistent. I am using it with Simplify3D, which I also recommend. I have printed PLA and ABS with no issues. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Love this device. I'm in the 3D printing game!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device! Probably didn't need the second extruder, but given the quality of the build, simple minimal assembly, and relative ease of use this is well worth the price. I basically use makerbot's software without any problem. Had an issue with 2nd extruder not being level and customer service has been great with assistance. Definitely recommend! My kids light up when I make "toys" for them.
customer_reviews.author: Doc B

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 3d printer. The first one was a kit that I had to put together. I was really disappointed with that one and had reservations about purchasing another 3d printer. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised with this one. I have printed many objects that I have downloaded and one that I created myself in OpenScad. I had some minor issues with objects sticking to the platform. I am still working through what platform materials to use and when, But that isn't a printer issue. Printing with both extruders is a little hard, but not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: not for ghe
customer_reviews.text: prints stick hard unless you upgrade to different print bed. one extruder sfepper motor died in 35 days from new. seems to be good quality otherwise, just not for a non-DIY user
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid-performing 3D printer with a lot of versatility at a great price. It's basically the same as a Makerbot Replicator 2x at a third the price. I've mostly used the Makerbot software for printing, and the experience has been very good. I've successfully printed with ABS and PLA. It took me a while to get everything dialed in, but if you take notes on temps, bed surface prep, print speed, and the like, you'll soon figure out what works best for your machine (PLA is my favorite; for me, it prints best on blue painter's tape with an unheated bed and a really light layer of glue stick).
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Kittle

customer_reviews.title: Flashforge Creator Pro is a sturdy reliable machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd printer I bought from Flashforge, this printer is a workhorse and it works well. I own 3 3d printers, a Replicator 2, a Flashforge Dreamer and this one. This is by far the best of the 3 despite the Flashforge dreamer being a newer printer with more updated electronics. This creator pro just works much better. I have to relevel the plate a lot more often than my other printers, but I'm so used to it now it only takes seconds to do between prints. I recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, simple setup if you're patient.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, good online community. The lack of auto level doesn't bother me, it's simple and quick to level, maybe 10 minutes once you get the hang. ABS and PLA prints are really nice, still dialing in PETG, but its pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: MoonShadow

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Got it as a Christmas present for myself. It's very easy to set up and use. However, I kind of want to return it because it's more noisy than anticipated. I should have read the other reviews more carefully. If you have a separate area in your home where you can let the print run without hearing it then you should definitely buy it.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product! Basically plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Basically plug and play. I spent the most part of 30 minutes, plugging together the 3D printer and ran the stock 3D examples from the SD Card. Works brilliantly! I did upgrade the nozzles to accept more abrasive materials as the stock nozzles kept clogging when using wood filament.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Work well at first,...no customer support
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked well for the first three months, but now it will not finish a print job. I e-mailed customer service twice and haven't gotten a response in two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from Lower Hudson Valley

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, it has the ability for anyone just getting into 3D Printing. I had a few issues like to written instructions in the box, and a packing issue but the seller has contact me about this and it is being resolved as we speak, You can be up and printing within an hour of unboxing this. I am very impressed with flash forge and they blow makerbot out of the water for the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kost

customer_reviews.title: You wont find a better printer for a better price than this
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a work horse. You wont find a better printer for a better price than this. Also, the support for this is amazing. they are getting back to you with any questions you have with in 15-20 hours. Amazing considering they are over seas. The one thing i would recommend they send out with the SD card, is the file for leveling your print heads. Other than that. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: but I've printed several models and was very happy with the quality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I'm new into 3D printing, but I've printed several models and was very happy with the quality and ease of use. On the downside, my printer came with a very loud fan, but someone from this company contacted me asking how everything was and I told them about the fan problem. They shipped me another fan, no questions asked and the new fan was quiet. Another problem was that one of the spools of plastic was not spooled very well and I had to stick around to make sure that the line on the spool did not tangle. Otherwise, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my engineering college student son for Christmas. He loves it. He picked it up very quickly and already printed out several items. I had contacted Tang a couple of times after the purchase and he was always very responsive. My son printed out a couple of mods for the printer which I would definitely recommend. They help keep the ABS filament on the spool (see photos). I would recommend this 3d printer to any enthusiast wanting to purchase one.
customer_reviews.author: Slittle255

customer_reviews.title: Poor tech support & problem leveling
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked fine for a couple of months, and then it became unable to be leveled. It the back two nozzle;s are adjusted the front is against the build plate and is all the way down. I tried contacting the technical support and didn't really get any help, a few vague suggestions that didn't help. This printer cost over $800 and I'm ready to dumpster it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Avina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty’s good.
customer_reviews.text: Stepper motors get really hot. Very hard to level the extrudes. Prints very messy when printing with both filaments. While one is working the other slowly bleeds plastic even with filament retracted to prevent it. I’d rather have a single extruded printer. But so far no other problems.
customer_reviews.author: BK17

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking printer, easy to assemble nozzle... when i printed the first time it made the worst noise i have ever heard in my life. second try it didn't even print. This is a piece of garbage from China. I ended up getting a Creality Ender 3 Pro for half as much and it works twice as well. I don't really care that I cant print in multiple colors now, I am just gald to get that Flashforge garbage out of my house.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression is good. From sealed in box to first print in ...
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression is good. From sealed in box to first print in 1.5 hours, and my 13 and 16 year old managed it by themselves. I think that speaks to the maturity of the technology, and the quality of this printer. I gave it five stars for letting Dad relax on Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: G. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Shipping damage
customer_reviews.text: I decided on this model printer primarily because of the reviews concerning support. My printer arrived with some minor shipping damage, so I sent an email to Tang. Within a couple of hours he responded and said he would ship a new panel to replace the one that was damaged, and suggested what to do about a bent screw. The panel damage is cosmetic, and the other part has been taken care of. The printer is up and running doing a great job. Thank you Tang!
customer_reviews.author: Comanche

customer_reviews.title: Never got it to do anything but the startup demo
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of cash. No support in English. Website sucks and even YouTube the old reliable source of info has next to nothing on this thing. I think all of their product stars were done by them. Don’t buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value of 2014
customer_reviews.text: Quite good so far, the packing is very secure and tight. all the part were in the and plenty spares nut and bolts. The acrylic door holes were off spec (the handler was about 3 mm wider) a quick Buff with a file fix it. There is a 2GB quicktime instructions to download from dropbox to setup the acrylic top cover... but is really not necessary simple common sense and care works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Alex

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. NEVER WORKED ONCE
customer_reviews.text: Big piece of crap. Over 2 weeks of trying to fix something that never worked out of the box. Sending it back. Definitely do not buy. All instructions followed correctly and Im an engineer that works with their hands on mechanisms and electronics all day. This thing is trash. Do not buy. No wonder price drops a hundred bucks every week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but so far this software that came with it is fine and free so that's good
customer_reviews.text: Have printed a few things so far. Seems to work very well. The Replicator G Sailfish software is ok, but I have solidworks and a background in CAD. I'll probably look at some other software options for the printer, but so far this software that came with it is fine and free so that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Loki

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: Our son has loved this and it’s been working tirelessly since Christmas. Well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine, Unbeatable Value!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this printer. Upon arrival the sensor on the platform was a bit "tweaked" due to shipping and Tang (The Seller) eagerly assisted in fixing the problem. I have printed many items with this wonderful machine just finishing up one of the two spools of material that shipped with the printer. I've only used one extruder to date, and have been printing with ABS. I did manage to damage the Kapton tape while attempting to level the bed due to the sensor misalignment. I simply ordered some replacement tape and reapplied once resolved. I would definitely recommend this machine and look forward to letting the creative juices flow.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Printer does a great job....very happy with the results. We are making all kinds of stuff haha. My son even made Drogon from the GOT.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Guillotte

customer_reviews.title: Great support, well made product with rich ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: Great product for getting into 3D printing, with rich ecosystem of models and community to offer help. The email support from the official FlashForge support person (Mr. Tang) is excellent- he always replies within a day with detailed and helpful instructions. The product itself is well made, very easy to take apart and put back together. Really enjoying this new hobby.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 3D Printer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 3D printer for home projects! I am a mechanical engineer with industry experience in 3D printing and the FlashForge Creator Pro is an excellent value for the money. It takes a little time to learn the software but I love the open source style and ability to control the hardware/process. It might be a little daunting for first time 3D printers but the default settings are good starting place for common materials. Also, Mr. Tang's support is great! I ran into an odd tool path global offset after about 5 months of use and he responded immediately with suggested fixes - I was back to printing within a day!
customer_reviews.author: Bio Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Solid 3D printer for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this printer 4 stars because it works fairly well for PLA prints right out of the box. If it would have come with a removable glass bed I would have given it four stars. I highly recommend a glass bed upgrade for this printer. I have not had any issues so I can't comment on FLASHFORGE customer service.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gatenby

product_meta.title: FlashForge 3D Printer Creator Pro, Metal Frame Structure, Acrylic Covers, Optimized Build Platform, Dual Extruder W/2 Spools, Works with ABS and PLA
product_meta.description:
Leaving our competition a step or two behind, these new features are only available on the new FlashForge Creator Pro:
The new front door comes pre-installed, and has been re-designed to provide easier access to prints.
The new injected PC top cover comes in one solid piece, making it stronger and more effective at regulating temperature.
The new, larger platform adjusting screws have been re-engineered for easier use.
The new extruder wiring router can protect wiring from wear and tear efficiently

What’s in the box?

The Creator Pro
Dual Extruder
2x spool holders
2 spools filament(N.W.:1 kilogram per spool, material and color are randomly selected)
2x spare blue platform stickers
2x filament guide tubes
2 M3×8 screws, 3 wrenches in different sizes, 1 spare leveling knob, 2 spare Teflon tubes, 1 unclogging pin and grease in tool bag
Extruder’s accessory kit Containing turbo fan duct, 2 M3×8 screws, M3×6 screw
Power cord
USB cable
Injected PC top cover
1 x 16GB SD card (contains software ReplicatorG and FlashPrint, test sample files and operation manual)

Compatible Software: ReplicatorG, FlashPrint and Simplify3D(Please kindly noted that Simplify3D is a third party paid software, which is not included in this package.
If user want to use, please buy it by yourself)
Compatible OS: Windows, Mac OSX and Linux
Print from SD card or over USB cable
Input file type: STL, gcode, x3g Printing Build envelope: 225 x 145 x 150 mm
Build volume: About 5 liters
Layer thickness: 0.1-0.3 mm(adjustable)
Nozzle diameter: 0.4 mm
Materials : Works well with 1.75 mm ABS and PLA.

Support Contact Information
If you encounter any issues with your FlashForge purchase or have any questions, please contact the support.
feature_bullets: Full manufacturer's warranty fulfilled by Flashforge, and free email support provided by expert FlashForge technicians
A sturdy metal frame that is substantially more stable than the Creator's original wood frame.Build volume 8.9 X 5.8 X 5.9 inches
Aviation level aluminum plate with a thickness of 6.3mm guarantee its surface is completely flat and will not warp during heating process

Metal platform support plus 10mm guide rod ensure a precise Z axis movement and prevent platform arm from deforming. Filament Compatibility- PLA, ABS, PLA Color Change, Pearl, ABS Pro, Elastic, PVA, HIPS, PETG, TPE, TPU, Conductive Filament, Flexible Filament, Metal Filled Filament, Wood Filled Filament, and PP
Enclosed chamber insulates and protects ABS prints.Filament Diameter:1.75 mm [0.069 in]
Please refer the user manual below for better use

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
